friend.  Later I found them together and was convinced that there 
was something fishy.

When I went to see the dead body of my uncle.  This was a very 
dramatic expreience as it was the first time that I entered a 
mortuary.

When I heard that I had got the best result in school and would 
be definately selected to the university of Zambia.

When I learnt that my younger sister had been expelled from 
secondary school because she was pregnant.  That was the second 
time that this happened in the family - the first time it had 
been my elder sister.

When I realized that I was in hospital after a car accident and 
that I had a scleral tear in my left eye.

When I was accepted into the medical school.  Medicine is a 
profession that I have desired ever since my childhood.

When I was accused of having planned my friend's outing at 
secondary school (boarding) as we were not allowed to go out.

When I realized the burden it was for my mother to look after all 
of us, all by herself.

When I heard that I had been selected fot the first year at the 
university of Zambia.  This was after my form five at Chikola 
secondary school.

When my brother-in-law's brother stole my clothes when my 
brother-in-law and I had gone to cut wood for the fire.

When I heard that my father had been involved in a car accident 
in Lusaka.  This happened when he had gone to get the car which 
had been stolen in Lusaka.
When I won the best prize in the National science fair.
Being hooted at when I was learning to drive.
When my grandmother died - having to see my mother weep.

When I heard the examination results and when I recovered after 
having been sick for a week.

When someone took my things without having asked for my 
permission.
When my father passed away.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at the medical school.

When my room-mate was making noise deliberately, by playing a 
flute early in the morning while I was trying to study.
When my grandmother passed away.
When I was selected to the university of Zambia.
When a few girls were talking rubbish about me.
When my beloved uncle was shot dead by relatives.

When I was offered a place in the university as a full time 
student.

When our government decided to withdraw student allowances as it 
was one of the conditions imposed by the IMF.

When my father was imprisoned for burning the house of his 
younger brother.
When I heard that I had passed the second year exams.

When I heard that an acquaintance of mine was spreading rumours 
about my affair with a close friend.

When a close friend of mine collapsed and passed away and the 
illness was not known.
When I qualified for form I.

When the paramilitary was sent to the UNZA and it started using 
tear gas and started intimidating the students without any 
provocation.
When my grandfather died.

When the Cambridge results came out and I obtained a first 
division.  I had been thinking that I had not done very well.

In form three we were taking our mock exams and someone else (a 
friend) was making noise when the examinateur picked on me and 
said that he would tear up my answer sheet.  I got very angry 
with the girls involved.
When my brother (5th in the family) passed away.
When I passed and qualified for the university.

When my father failed to send me transport money after the 
closure of the school.

When my parents separated temporarily and I was left behind with 
my father.  As I loved my mother I wanted to go with her.

A few weeks back I received a Christmas card from a friend in 
England.  She had not written to me in a very long time but it     
showed that she still remembered me.

I once failed a test miserably and my friend did very well and 
someone made a nasty comment while comparing me to my friend.

A friend of mine got pregnant anf failed the first year at 
university.  The boyfriend refused his responsibility and they 
ended up in court.
When I heard that I had been selected for the university.

The government's announcement of the withdrawal of the student 
allowances in 1984.
When I first suffered from syphilis.

When I was with the girl I love very much, for the graduatiion 
ball.

I was really angry when the President general of UNZASU was 
arrested by policemen.

When one of my closest friends failed to make it to the third 
year of university.
When my parents complimented me very nicely on something.
[ When some difference of opinion occurs in a silly situation.]

I wanted something in particular and did not get it, also there 
was no possibility of getting it.
When I got engaged to a boy of my choice.
When my mother scolded me for coming home late, i.e after 7 P.M.
When my grandfather died.
When I passed my B.A exams.

When my boyfriend told me that it would be difficult for him to 
marry me.
When I left my part-time job.
Being chosen to do this experiment.
Someone borrowed my textbook and deliberately did not return it.
I like someone who does not like me and was rude to me.
Doing well in the examn.
Bad food in the students' dining hall.
Could not get into the university I wanted to get in.
Getting into this university to do medicine.
Someone messing up the room we share.
My best friend could not get into university.
Reading a nice book and talking about it to my friend.
Insulted by the class leader.
Saying goodbye to a friend.
Going to a concert.
Tripped on a busy street.
A child beaten up by his mother.
Good dinner on the National Day.
Seeing this badly made questionnaire.
You ignored the fact that we could not hear you at the back.
Watching the Asian Olympic game (China winning).

People having a football match outside the window during the 
lecture.

China can not even give you good sound systems for an open 
lecture.
Got a big fish in fishing.
A father helping his kid to fight other kids.
A father of 4 children killed in an accident.
When my boyfriend and I made up.

My mother and my sister carried on picking at me all day long for 
no reason at all and I ended up getting angry.

When my boyfriend almost had a relationship with a close friend 
of mine.

At church camp when I accepted Christ into my life and so did my 
friend.

During the summer I received grade cards from my TA's. I expected 
a B no better in Computer Science. I looked at the card - I got an 
A - I was ecstatic.

A friend of mine came to visit and stayed with my roommate and me. 
My roommate and she became good friends. After she left, he 
didn't talk too highly of her.
After receiving the grade on the paper mentioned in FEAR.
When seeing a friend that I had not seen in a long while.

I felt anger at my roommate due to his habit of leaving dirty 
dishes in the sink and generally not cleaning after himself.

When my grandmother after staying with us for awhile went back 
home.

Achieving my goal at a swim meet. I worked toward the goal for 9 
yrs. I was capable of achieving it, but I didn't know when.

Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had a 
stress fracture. The anger came when the senile doctors found out 
4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot and 
should have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely could 
walk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.

Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and 
cried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for a 
few days.

It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the 
first time in 3 months. She's my best friend and extremely close.

When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at the 
world, and her murderer who was her ex-boyfriend. It was the worst 
and most hateful day of my life.

I spent a weekend in San Diego visiting my boyfriend Rob. We were 
at the airport and my plane was just about so leave. After saying 
goodbye, I boarded the plane. It was the hardest thing to do and 
it was a sad trip home.

I got an A in anatomy - the first one I have ever gotten in a 
science class here.

Saying goodbye at the airport to my boyfriend who has to go to 
school back East. We are very close and have been together 4 
years.

Went to a movie with a date, walked on the beach (in Alameda) 
spent some time afterwards in her apt.

I am currently taking CS 50P. I had to finish a couple of 
assignments but I was hindered because I could not get a passing 
score on my program.
The girl I was seeing didn't want to have a serious relationship.
I asked someone to go out and she accepted right away.

During a dance someone slashed my tires and dumped paint on my 
car. I had four other friends with me that I drove and 
furthermore it was raining.

When I was trying for a girl who I really liked and cared for and 
thought she felt the same way too. But she didn't like the idea 
and just wanted to stay friends.
Finished a difficult midterm.
I was called racial slurs behind my back.
My grandmother died during Christmas break several years ago.
Did very, very well on a Physics midterm.

A friend doesn't let me study when I want to. She doesn't feel I 
need to study and doesn't understand how important studying is to 
me. I get very angry with her.

Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brother 
became allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals and 
lots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit our 
rabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventually 
died.
When I won my car.

I came home one day and discovered that my sister had borrowed my 
car and had gotten into an accident with it. My entire front 
bumper was destroyed.
When I heard the news that my grandfather had died.

At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed 
eachothers company, while slow dacing.

I live with my sister now and sometimes she angers me especially 
when she thinks I don't keep the apt. clean enough.

When I found out that I could not go to the concert (after buying 
the tickets) because of a biology test which occurred the morning 
after.

When I was a Sr. in HS. one of the class counselors died of 
hepatitis. She was very sensitive. She knew my shyness and drew 
me out to improve myself image. I missed her funeral - so I could 
not publically grieve. My parents didn't understand.
Someone (a boy) paid special attention to me.

My roommate leaving my drawers in a mess after plowing thourgh 
them looking for something.
My friend who was in the Bago was kicked out of the sorority.
My last genetices midterm - a decent grade.

When someone threw a firecracker into my room at 7:00 am in the 
morning.
A close friend of the family died.

I received an unexpected B+ on an engineering midterm. I did not 
study nearly as much as I should have and it was a difficult 
test.

I was supposed to meet my girlfriend at a pre-arranged place but 
it took me an hour to find her.

My grandmother died over the summer. I knew her very well, she 
baked great biscuits. She was in the hospital but expected to 
improve and go home soon. She died in her sleep.
Finding out my grades at the end of my freshman year.

When I found out that my good friend and roommate did not pay the 
phone bill and electric bill like he promised and let me down.

When I found out that my girlfriend would not be coming back to 
UCB for one semester, but would be living in San Jose.
Going to Chico to visit a friend.

When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me in 
public.
My roommate's sister committed suicide.
When  fell in love with my present girlfriend.

When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playing 
around on me.
When my grandmother passed away.
I got a very good grade on one of my midterms a few weeks ago.

My peers didn't want me to meet someone during rush for fear that 
I would give her a bad outlook on our Sororoty house. I shouldn't 
have seen this, but they blew and I did.
I was told that a friend of a friend committed suicide.

When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Football 
and our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and brought 
our joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that no 
one expected we would win.

I had worked long and hard on a project when a friend 
inadvertantly destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a long 
time. And at times still get angry at him.

When a pet died. The pet was the closest friend I had for 15 
years.
Getting my accentance letter from CAL.
I went out dancing and found my boyfriend kissing another girl.

At the end of my senior yr. in high school I found out that a 
friend of mine I knew had cancer had been diagnosed as terminally 
ill.

Today I did a lot better on my architecture project than I 
expected.

This summer I got into a fight with one of our patrons (at a 
theatre). He hit me and I hit him and her friend, he hit my friend 
and we all hit eachother.

This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the second 
time.
When I received a letter of acceptance to CAL.
When someone told a secret I told them not to tell.
When my mother was very sick and almost died.
I gave my mom a gift she wanted for years. I raflected her joy.

After a long trip in my dad's van without incident I stopped to 
fill the tank with gas and dented the side of the van against the 
pole. Then my cars electrical system would not work when I tried 
to drive home from his house.

At one point in a relationship, my boyfriend was seeing an old 
flame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed.

When I finally got a job after days of wondering whether I would 
be hired or not and counting on the money that it would bring.

A time when, as part of my work, I was sent out actually sort of 
volunteered to run an errand for someone who had no authority to 
send me out and the address was very far especially on foot and 
turned out to be incorrect too. The whole trip was a waste.

When my boyfriend said he did not want to see me anymore (which 
turned out to be untrue).

Yesterday when I received a B on a history midterm. I felt 
overjoyed after having received C's previously.

A month ago when one of my fellow workers got a promotion over 
me. It was just a small promotion but recognition was involved.

When another fellow worker decided to leave the company. We had 
been very close and we would not be able to work with eachother 
any longer.

When I drove partially across the country with my father. We 
stopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy I 
got was from the feedom I felt and the real beauty of the 
country.

I can't remember being truly angry. Usually it's just 
disappointment that I feel. One situation would be with my 
brother. He and I used to be close but now he seems to be 
avoiding me.

4 years ago my family decided to move from New York to 
California. From the time we decided to move until the time we 
left, I realized how much my friends cared for me. When we left 
and for a long time after that I was very sad.
The last time I had sex.

Physically fighting with my girlfriend because she just walked 
out of a room of my friends and had pushed and cursed at me when 
I went to find her.

Hearing about a friend back home that had to have his stomach 
pumped because he had overdosed on pills.

Reading a letter from a close friend who said he missed me and 
cared for me.
When a close friend did not write.
Leaving high school.
I went home and visited with my family and friends.

While I was away for the weekend some friends went into my room 
and played my very expensive stereo without asking me or my 
roommate.
I asked a girl out on a date and she said no.

Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months of 
separation from summer.

I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on 
it. I tried to fix it but could not.

Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and 
I had not seen him for 10 years.

My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-up 
on to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be two 
mimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good, 
it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.

I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I was 
finally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first I 
accepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they're 
paying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad said 
to me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cut 
me off financially and emotionally.

We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died while 
visiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me an 
hour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a door 
between himself and everything had closed and locked forever.
When I found our my mother didn't have cancer.
When some friends betrayed my friendship.

When I did bad on a chamistry midterm which I could have done 
well.

Riding home from school after completing two midterms in two 
days, and feeling I did well on them.

Argument with roommate over a lock he had put on kitchen cupboard 
without telling anyone.
Day time robbery of our house.
When I found out I got accepted to Berkeley.

When a friend carelessly broke and object in my parent's house 
and did not apologize, or pay, or anything.
I felt sadness when my grandfather died.

On my birthday, my closest friends were here at Berkeley pithched 
in a lot of money each and bought me ten records to replace some 
of my records that were stolen. They threw a small surprise party 
for me too.

I received a poor grade on a midterm even though I got all the 
right answers and knew the material. I went to the TA to try to 
raise my grade and he wouldn't do it.

My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time. 
She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to the 
relationship without going out with other people. I was her first 
boyfriend.

A co-worker and I had to rush a project. I was only working there 
for one month and he for some years. Instead of letting me know 
that he wanted to do the project himself, he went to the 
superviser and let the superviser tell me to let the co-worker do 
it himself since he was quicker at it.

Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a 
few days before and then one morning it was gone.

I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had good 
food, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warm 
atmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well. 
I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with her 
giving her a neck massage.

I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angered 
me greatly.
My grandfather died thirteen years ago.

My parents and brother came up over the weekend. We are a very 
close family. This was my first year away from home. They brought 
one jacko-lantern with a new design. That is the old joke that 
we have a great new design - it's always the same.

While studying chemistry with a friend we became angry with 
eachother because we were both fed up.

I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviusly 
suffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. She 
mentioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.

Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous 
when my school's team won the conference championship last year.

I was really pissed when the Russians boycotted the '84 Olympics. 
I had anger towards them and Jimmy Crter. I was very anxious to 
see it.

It made me very sad to hear that some construction company was 
going to build houses on the beautiful hills by my house.

I took a math midterm and I knew I did really well and it was 
Friday so I felt great joy because the week was over and I did 
well on a test.

When I was faced with writing an essay and I didn't want to do it 
I was angry that I had to write an essay and angry at myself for 
not having the time to write a good essay.

I ran a race for the CAL track team and I did terribly and then 
the coach said that I should sit out for the season. I felt 
really sad because I wasn't going to be able to run. It was 
something I always had done and now I couldn't do it anymore.

I had met someone and we became good friends. Our relationship 
grew closer and now he is my boyfriend. I felt joy when I found 
out how he felt about me.

One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. I 
thought she was kidding, but later I found out that she was 
serious.

One of my relatives became seriously ill. I felt sad because I 
didn't know if she will ever be the same again.

I spoke with a friend on the phone who I haven't seen in many 
years. It was a joyful event to talk to him.

I typed up a letter for this physician at work. She didn't care 
for my style, even though she was not using correct English. I 
told her it was her letter and we would do it her way.

Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant and 
died. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children.

My old boyfriend - yes the same one - asked me out. We had a good 
time. Then he asked me out the following week. He actually took 
interest.

My boyfriend breaking up with me about 7 months after I had an 
abortion. Just the fact that he was ignoring me and continued to 
do so.

My nephew's mother just left one day (my brother and she were 
not married). My nephew, Anthony, was shaken. I was sad for him 
because a similar situation happened to me.
When I got accepted to CAL.

When my roommate's boyfriend assaulted me. He was threatening me, 
calling me names and pushing me around.

I was going to go on a vacation to Texas this summer but was 
unable to go because of registration.

After being depressed because of a very bad relationship, my 
first love called me and told me that he would always care for me 
no matter what I did.

When someone tried to rape one of my best friends and he claimed 
it was her fault. He the hassled her, claimed she was loose, and 
threatened to sue her.

My mother kicked my surrogate father out and he in turn did not 
care for the dog, Afthur, he bought for the family. His lack of 
concern lead tho Arthur's death on the freeway. I loved Arthur 
like a brother. He was easy to talk to.

I spent a lovely relaxing evening with my boyfriend. We played 
games and talked all evening.
When my roommate's moped was stolen I was very angry.
When I heard my grandfather's wife had leukemia I was very sad.

Third highest grade in the class and the best answer given for 
one question (the question was graded by the professor and he 
indicated he liked my answer).

We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enact 
plans to paint my room without consulting me.

Recent break-up with my girlfriend. We had been together for over 
a year. I was overseas and discovered over the phone (while I was 
at work).

After watching the 49ers lose game after game, year after year, I 
was finally rewarded with a Super Bowl victory which made me 
extremely happy.

I was rushing home from school because there was a 49er game that 
night. I got into a non-injury accident, which was all my fault, 
but destroyed the front of my car. The truck I hit was undamaged.

When I learned that my dad had cancer. I knew he was going to the 
hospital for some tests. My mom told me when she picked me up one 
weekend from CAL to take me home.
I felt joy when my boyfriend proposed to me in marriage.

After I said something that my boyfriend disagreed with, he 
walked away from me without discussing what bothered him. I 
became very angry with him for treating me this way. Yesterday, 
November 14.
I felt sad when my boyfriend and I were apart for some time.

After much trouble getting together in the first place my 
boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.

Sometimes when I go to work my crazy boss (a hyper Jewish lawyer) 
insists I do things his way (filing, typing, etc.). He sometimes 
blames me for things I didn't do, and I can't yell back at him.

Since I moved into the dorms and I've been spending most of my 
free time with my boyfriend. I hardly see my old high school 
friends. I had several bad incidents with my 2 past best friends.

Winning a close volleyball game. (I'm on the intercollegiate team 
at CAL)
Same situation as before - having my car stolen.
When a close friend drowned in the American River.

Getting sent on a company expense trip to another state to work 
for a week at that plan.

Having my personal objects rearranged by someone else without my 
consent and having it arranged to their taste. Then trying to 
find a particular object they rearranged for an hour or more.
Death of my father.

When I finished my C.S. Project I was overjoyed. I felt relieved 
because it was due the next day and I was tired of looking at it.

I came out of the house at 7:20 am Monday morning getting ready t 
go to school and fight for a parking when I saw my car had a flat 
tire.

After my little sister's Graduation from High School my 
grandmother became very sick. She passed away a few months later.

A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) many 
friends were present and good music.

I was stood up for a date function by someone who I really cared 
for.

After blowing up and saying all the wrong things, I realized what 
I had done and hurt that person and myself.
I realized the girl liked to be with me.

When my dad told me about something he had done against my 
mother.
When I heard my sister got in a bad car accident.
When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.
When I failed my S.S.C exam.
When my sister left home to go and live with her husband.

My first feeling of falling in love.  Coming across a person who 
made me feel love, happiness, joy, giving me a new and beautiful 
future, who made me dream.

I was angry at my brother over an argument we had together.  We 
do have a few fights from time to time, and also at times I take 
out my anger on him.

When I came to know that my feelings for someone were not 
reciprocated.

After my marriage I received the B.Sc results by post, I was very 
happy to learn that I had got very good marks - first class.

I felt angry when my mother-in-law did not handle my daughter 
properly and she fell down from the bed and hurt her head.

I was very sad when I could not take the M.A (I) exams due to 
illness, and a relative of mine disheartened me about it.
When my family allowed me to do higher studies.

When my father talks about our relatives and favours them, I feel 
angry.
[ When my elders do not understand me in the right way.]

I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen 
for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some 
ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.

I was walking on a street alone in the afternoon when there were 
not too many people on the street.  A couple of guys were 
following me and I was ignoring them.  Suddenly one of them came 
in front of me and started using dirty language and harrassing 
me.  I got very angry and wanted to strike back at them.

A close friend of mine was to get married in a weeks time when 
her father died of a heart-attack.  I knew him well and felt bad 
on hearing of his death.

When I got permission to study at a place which was far away from my 
home.
[ I feel angry when somebody is unjust to me.]
[ I feel sad when somebody is unjust to me.]
When I went for a picnic in Lonavala, I felt full of joy.
I was angry this morning when I missed the train to university.
When I missed my train this morning, I felt sad for some time.

I acted in an English play in college and got the Best Actress 
award, while our play got the first place.

I was to meet a friend at the bus-stop (he was coming to visit 
us) and he did not turn up.  After having waited for him for some time     
(about an hour) I called him up, to be told that he did not 
intend to come as he was feeling tired.
When my sister died in a fire accident at home.

When I passsed the M.S.C board exams with first class, which I 
had not expected.

When my friend promised that she would come to my place, and did 
not turn up - I was annoyed at her.

[ When someone tells me something that hurts me, I feel bad about 
it and also feel sad.]
I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.

I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we  
started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started 
teasing me.

My best friend got married and left her home-town to go and live 
in Poona.  After her wedding I felt sad.
When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.
When I failed the M.S.C exams.
When my father was ill.

Last year I passed the B.A exams in Psychology in which I stood first 
in my class.  Thus I got the first prize from the college.  I was 
most happy to tell all this to my parents and friends.

A few months ago when I was teaching, I suddenly became very 
angry at the children and slapped some of them.

My friend got married and went abroad, this made me feel sad and 
lonely.

When I got a first class in the twelveth standard exams, I was very 
surprised and happy and I had a very good time with my friends.

When I was at S.Y.Bajaj I wanted to get admission in another 
college and this was not easy and I felt angry.

When my mother scolded me for something, very insignificant, without 
knowing the real cause of what had happened.

After completing high-school, I wanted to go abroad for a 
holiday.  I had never been abroad before and neither had I taken 
a holiday for a long time.  When finally my parents agreed and we 
got the airplane tickets I was over joyed.

When I see people with burns I feel sad, actually I can not even 
express my feelings as I think that they must suffer a lot.

Day before yesterday my mother bought me a new pair of shoes, 
without my having asked for them.  She told me that when she saw 
the pair of shoes she felt like buying them for me.  I really 
liked the shoes and they made me feel that my mother cares for 
me.

One of my friends asked me to go shopping with her, another 
friend of hers was also coming along.  During the outing they 
kept talking to each other and I felt left out, even when I tried 
to talk to them they seemed not to listen to me and did not pay 
me much attention.

Two years ago my best friend died in an accident, just a day 
before my birthray.  We were very close to each other and I felt 
very sad at loosing a close friend.

When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and 
there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.

I am separated from my husband.  The way he has behaved towards 
me makes me angry.

When my husband lied to me, tricked me and when I had to leave my 
home.
When I got married.

A girl whom I trusted and with whom I had shared personal, confidential 
matters twisted the facts and told it to a common friend of ours. 
 When this common friend told me the version my friend had told 
her, I was angry.
When my elder sister died.

The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of 
us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had 
no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got 
engaged.

One morning I was standing at the bus-stop and the bus passed by 
without stopping, even though there were only 8-10 passengers 
inside.  I felt angry at the rude behaviour of the bus driver and  
conductor.

At the death of my friend's father and especially as this 
happened ten days before her wedding.

When I succeeded in achieving a scholarship for which I had 
strived hard during a period of financial, personal and physical 
stress.

I was not given a chance to explain to my close relatives as to 
why I could not go to visit them when they were ill.  When I did 
go, they thought that I had been selfish and irresponsible during
their illness.

I put in two years of hard work and it was neither looked at nor 
appreciated.

[ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing 
which is part of my work.  Intense reading also brings me joy.  I 
also feel happy when I reminiscent about them.]

Uncleaniness at my work place.  The place is generally not very 
clean, but when it reaches a point, I get angry at the person 
who is supposed to clean the place and the people who are 
supposed to supervise him.

Three weeks ago a friend of mine bid me good-bye before going 
abroad.  I felt happy for her as she was achieving something by 
making the trip, but I also felt sad as I would not be seeing her 
for a long time.

When I got the scholarship I was very happy as the finacial 
burden of the family was reduced.

When the others did not do their bit of work on a group 
assignment task, and I had to do all the work.

After having been ill, when I was coming back to the hostel, I 
felt very sad leaving home.
When I was selected at TISS X.
When I was insulted by a man.
When my mother left for Kenya.

At the pre-university, I was appreciated as an examplary 
student by our pricipal.  This is something which made me feel 
very happy.

When I was blamed for some of my attributes which are very often 
misunderstood, especially when one is very frank.

When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.  I 
felt very bad about it as this was the first death in my family 
and then I learned slowly to understand to life.

The day I got a letter from the U.G.C informing me that I had 
been awarded the junior research fellowship.

When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidyness 
and dirtyness.
When I had to leave home to go to some other place to study.

[ When I have achieved what I wanted to achieve, I feel the above 
stated emotion. Also when I am sucessful.]

My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and he 
had promised to come and pick me up.  But he did not turn up and 
I felt very angry at him.

I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but I 
failed and so I felt very sad.

When I stood first in the B.A exams.  Earlier I had heard of 
these boys and girls who were toppers, but when I first heard of 
me having topped I could not believe it.

I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept      
on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect 
me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.

When I heard the news of the death of my father.  It was in the 
evening and I was alone all night in my room trying to remember 
the face of my father.

When the results of the part I exams came out I felt tremendous 
joy in my heart.  The results came out after a long period of 
worry and anxiety, so it gave me endless relief and joy.

I remember that when I was in school I saw a case of partiality - 
one of the teachers gave private coaching classes to some girls 
and she would give these girls extra attention in class and would 
ignore the others.

On the last day of my school life I was very sad, specially on 
the farewell party day.  I felt sad to leave behind my beloved 
teachers and friends.
[ I can not recall one.]

[ This emotion has never been an intense one, that makes it 
difficult to recall it.]
When my honest intentions were marred by another's jealousy.

The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call 
from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of 
the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was 
an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I 
had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

I experience this emotion quite often but the day I was most 
angry was the day I got pulled up for something I had not done.  
It happened during my school days, I had not spoken a word in 
class but the monitor had written my name on the board.  So I 
had a remark in my callender which I had to get signed by my 
parents.  This remark resulted in me being spanked.

I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was when I was trying 
to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of 
materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play 
fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.  
Now when I think of it, I laugh it off but at that time it was 
intense.

This happened when it was finally confirmed that I had stood 
first in the university for the M.A exams.  A few days before the 
official results were declared a clerk had brought the results 
unofficially.  So I had been expecting the results but the 
confirmation allowed me to legitimately feel happy at my 
success.

A new gas connection was to be installed and the mechanic who came 
to do it was very rude to my mother and me.  I rushed to thhe 
dealer with my mother and had a fight with the dealer as he 
seemed to be unreasonable and was taking the mechanic's side.  
Ultimately the matter was resolved after my father went and spoke 
to him.  The mechanic was asked to apologize.

The day I was to receive my gold-medal for the M.A, my 
grandmother, who I loved very much, died after an illness.  She  
died a few hours before the convocation.  While I was 
attending the convocation I had to control my grief as she would 
not have liked me to miss it.  It was a day she had been waiting 
for, but did not get to see.

Inter-national sports events won by my favourite national team or 
player brings me joy, e.g when India won the World cup cricket 
match.

When I saw a few people beating a man who seemed to be a 
stranger.
When India lost the Benson and Hedges cricket trophy.

When India won the Prudential cup by beating West-Indies in the 
final match and became the world cricket champion.  West-Indies 
was the strongest of the eight countries which participated in 
the competition.

Despite our good performance and excellent results the management 
refused to meet our demands.
When my beloved girlfriend got married to another person.

I felt happy at the settlement of our marriage, even though we 
are from different socio-linguistic backgrounds our parents 
agreed to the wedding without any conflict or discussion.  We had  
thought that they would object to the wedding but it did not happen.

One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.  This was the 
first time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.  I 
requested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he did 
not care for what I was saying.  Finally I picked up an axe to use 
against him, in the meanwhile people intervened.

My close friend and I applied to TISS for admission last year, 
unfortunately he failed to get admission.  We had done our graduation 
together and are quite involved with each other, so we had wanted 
to do our Masters degree together.  However, it did not work out 
as we had expected it to and this saddened me.

When I was doing research a few months ago, I had asked the 
Institute to sponsor me for a computer course which was held in 
TISS.  However, because of the administrative officer I could not 
get the money.

When I was in Bombay one of my good friends was getting married 
and he had not informed me about it, this made me sad.
[ I am joyfull to be alive every night.]

[ On discovering the red-tapism and the bureaucratic, corrupt, 
decadent, degenerated infrastucture of every public utility, 
office and service and the rampant corruption at every single 
level of education and other institutions.]

The death of Jaya Prakash Narayan caused a great deal of sadness 
as I believed that he was the only true democrat and a ray of 
hope on the Indian horizon.

My joy knew no bounds when I was selected for a job even before 
having finished my studies.

I felt angry when repeated pleas to the ticket collector and the 
co-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.  I have 
this feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic in 
doing his duty.

I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person.  
More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of a 
death of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, with
vigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it.
When India first won the world cup cricket tournament.

I was travelling from Delhi to Bombay.  I had booked a seat one 
month back and I had also got a telegram confirming this.  
However, in the train my name had been omitted from the 
reservation sheet, and the one seat that was still vacant was 
alloted to another person who paid for it despite my requests for the 
seat.  I was allowed to stay in the reserved compartment when I 
paid money.

The news of the natural calamity, an earthquake in which hundreds  
of Mexican people died.

I felt happy at the end of a 10 day student camp.  We had shared 
our hopes and aspirations and in the open situation so generated, we 
had made strong frienships and experienced our own worth as well.

I had made an error in planning a programme and had publicly 
accepted the mistake, despite repeated requests not to bring the 
matter for discussion a professor kept constantly passing remarks. 
I reacted angrily.

I was in love with a girl but had to separate from her because of 
different commitments concerning life and career.  I loved her as 
a person but could not agree with the life the future would 
demand.  Parting from her was very sad.

This is one feeling I never betray, but I must confess that the 
last time I slighty felt happy was when I passed my M.A with a 
high rank.  This was a few years ago when my friend told me about 
the result.

A few days back a friend of mine poked me in the ribs for fun's 
sake, though I had warned him an infinite number of times that it 
really hurts me, he did it again.  I usually ignore this but this 
time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him 
up.  This is the latest incident when I lost my temper, though I 
felt very bad about it later.

The saddest moment in my life was when I lost my younger sister a 
few years back.
When I got my B.Sc degree with first class.
When I was punished in school for no serious mistake of mine.

When I received the S.Y.J.C results, the marks I obtained were 
not up to my expectations and I missed admission in engineering.

This happened when I was in the 10th standard.  The paddy crops 
were in a bad shape as it had not rained and there was no water 
in the well, so I was in a very sad mood.  I came to the 
conclusion that I would ignore the paddy field, just 12 hours 
after this it rained for one hour.  This was a very tense time 
and the rain brought me tremendous pleasure.

One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had done 
a few hours back.  I got very angry and started beating him up.

A few months a close relative of mine died.  I had never expected 
this to happen and was sad for a few months.

After my graduation exams I was waiting to get admitted to a post 
graduation course, however the situation was not very favourable 
for me and I was upset.  Suddenly, Bombay university offered me a 
seat and I landed up in Bombay for my post graduation studies.  
This happened last year and was very pleasant for me.

This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by 
a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally 
spoiled my New year's night.
[ When I feel that I have made a mistake.]
When I got my B.A degree with first class.

Once a friend had pushed me and I had fallen on to a window which 
then broke.  I was taken to tthe principal's office and he 
accused me of having broken the window.

When I received my S.Y.J.C results which did not allow me to get   
admission in engineering.
When I passed the 12th standard board exams.
During the short period of my unemployment about six years back.

My father's death in January 1983 moved me deeply.  The gloom 
prevailed for almost two years and I am still to recover from it.

After having finished my B.Sc, I was struggling hard to continue 
my studies and had taken the M.SC exam.  I was not sure that I 
would be selected in the written exam.  When I saw my name in the 
selected candidates list I was overjoyed.

When I was dancing with a dame at a social, one of my friends who  
was interested in her came and took her away from me.  I was 
really angry with him then.

When a close friend, residing in the hostel, lost his father I 
really pittied him and the situation made me feel sad.

I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate 
result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5 
times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.

Once I had an argument with my friends and I knew that I was 
right.  My friends went on arguing with me even though they did 
not know the right thing.
[ No response.]
When I realized that I loved someone of the opposite sex.

[ During my childhood when I could not get what I wanted from my 
brother/sister and parents.]

The way this particular girl spoke, behaved, and reacted the 
first time I was introduced to her, I felt certain that something 
between us would materialize.
[ Ther are many instances which are all equally irritating.]

When a girl did not answer a question, concerning my love for 
her, put forward to her.

I most joyous moment was the day I got my marks.  I was very 
happy when I came to know about my marks at the M.Sc (part I) 
examination where I got 71.5%.  This was the highest marks I have 
ever scored in my life.

When my brother was selected to the University of Malawi (the 
Polythecnic). I was very excited and I rejoiced due to one of our 
family members qualifying for University level at long last.

Sometime ago I felt very angry when my mother wrote me telling me 
that my elder sister was messing up things at home by her 
internalised aggressive attitude towards parents and her husband.

I felt very sad when I was in Form three to notice that my friend 
Barley Jumbe, had lost very expensive new sports short trousers.

After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in 
1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in the 
Examination when the results were out.

Somebody wanted to beat my brother at a wedding ceremony and I 
was trying to protect my brother but the other man was calling 
names to both of us.

I never failed my examinations since Standard 1 but I experienced 
sad moments when I sat for Standard 8 Examination and I was not 
selected for Secondary School education in 1978.

I was emotionally happy when I was in love with the girl I had 
longed for.

It happened that my brother promised to give me money for school 
and then he told me that he had failed to fulfil his promise a 
day before school started. I became so angry for I thought my 
future would be ruined.

I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who 
usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short 
illness.

Somebody was blaming me of a story which was not real and not 
true.

Death of my grnadfather after having been in hospital for so long 
with cancer of the Oesophagus.

When I passed my Primary school leaving certificate and selected 
to go to a Boarding secondary school.

We were just about to go into the Exam room and I didn't see all 
my writing materials plus the identification card from the place 
where I left them.

When my boyfriend did not turn up in time as he promised he would 
be coming.
Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.
An old lady slipped and nobody helped her.
A friend's mother died.
Made a wonderfull new friend.
Insulted by disgusting people.
My friend was badly hurt.

When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all 
lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only 
English classes)

My class leader told me I am not chosen for your English 
lectures.

Finding out that the university will give first priority to 
qualified practioners and clinical years to go to your English 
lectures.
Winning a game after a long time of losing.
People not cueing in the dining hall.
Failed an examn.
Being chosen to do your experiment with aphasia.

A classmate told me I must have bribed the class leader to let me 
go to your English lecture.
I was not chosen for the All English class.
I got better marks in the examn than many arrogant people.
Insulted by some stupid people.
Lost a friend.

I was most angry when India lost the Triangular Cricket trophy 
held in Australia.  I was so angry that I fought (orally) with my 
friend.

I was very sad  when I got the XIIth standard results, when I got 
low marks as compared to my friend and I could not get admission 
to courses like medicine.

When I got my first unknown compound while doing my M.Sc 
research, I was very happy.  This is because my research was based 
on this type of reactions and compounds.

When my neighbours accused my brother of stealing their 
rose-bush, I was very angry as he had not touched it at all.

When I heard that my girlfriend was getting married to another 
person, I felt very sad.  That day I did not eat anything and 
kept thinking of her all day long.

This happened a year when I was having a hard time, I got 
admission to do research despite obstacles in the procedure of admission.

I missed an opportunity to go abroad because of some silly 
mistakes for which I had to suffer a lot.

It was at the time of my M.Sc exam, when I was not in a position 
to take the exam after having studied seriously.
When I got the first compound through column.
When I got low marks in B.Sc final.
When my first love was not successful.

It was about a fortnight ago, I was declared successful in the 
U.G.C exam this year (only four in Bombay succeeded).  My joy 
knew no bounds.

This also happened when I was very small.  I was beaten up by my  
mother for no fault of mine, I had just beaten up my younger 
brother for what I thought was his fault.  I was very angry with 
my mother.

After studying a lot for my H.S.C exams, I could not make it to 
the medical stream and I felt sad about this.

When I got admission in M.Sc (I) Organic Chemistry, I was very 
happy.

I was very angry when my friend lost my practical's journal, 
which I needed to study for the exams.

I was very sad when I did not get admission in the English 
college, as I had 1% less marks than they wanted.
When I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.

When I was teased by my friend for not scoring good marks in the 
exams.
When I was ditched by my girlfriend.

The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.C 
junior national research fellowship.  It was a dream come true.

I wanted to go to Bhopal for relief work (gas tragedy).  My boss 
simply refused to let me go, I was so angry that the only thought 
that came to my mind was to quit the job.

A friend of mine was hospitalized after having been diagnosed as 
having typhoid, he had to forgo his exams and also his ambition 
of doing a dissertation at the M.A level.  It was a very sad 
event for me and I felt very sorry for him so I volunteered to 
stay with him in the hospital.

I have a girlfriend, who is almost like a daughter to me.  She is 
studying out of station and I get to see her only once a year.  
Her arrival is always a joyous one.

I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show 
rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.  
I felt frustation - bordering on anger.
[ No response.]
When I was successful at my work I was full of joy.

[ When bad and disgusting language is uttered by people, or when 
someone tries to show what is beyond his own capacities.]

[ I missed my twin when I was on the verge of being thrown, which 
I disliked.]

When I received the best actor award at the inter-college drama 
competition.  It gave me tremendous joy and satisfaction which 
lasted for several days.

When an acquaintance of mine beat up another person for no just 
reason, and thus showed off his power.

When a friend of mine died in a hiking accident.  I was not 
present there and only got the news later.

I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio that 
I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health 
Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.

I felt angry when my only pair of trousers was stolen and could 
not be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knew 
about the story.

I felt sad when my dear friend was needed from training school 
due to his failure in a number of subjects and simply didn't know 
what he had to do.

When I was at school, no one thought I could pass my MCE so at 
the end of the year my name was announced on the radio that I had 
passed. I was the happiest person.

My young brother took my wristwatch in my abscence and sold it to 
his friend at a cheaper price.

I had a girlfriend who lived several kilometers away from my 
home. One day she wrote me that she'd visit me. On her way she 
had a car accident and was badly injured. I was very sorry to see 
her lying in a bed in the hospital.
When I was accepted to study at this school I was very happy.

There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a raw 
paw-paw in the face.

It was last September when I felt very sad. It was when I heard 
that I was not selected to study in the University of Malawi.

It was in December last year that I was chosen to come to this 
Institution to study as a Medical Assistant.

I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certain 
man. I felt anger.

I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces and 
my name was cancelled on the list of nominees of those who were 
sent to Kenya for Training.

There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as a 
Medical Assistant.

A certain Area Party Secretary came home in the morning and said 
we had to leave our home and build somewhere and the reason 
being that they wanted to establish a market. The Chairman knew 
nothing about it and was very angry.

I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was 
the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.

When I was in Form 4, at Secondary School, I was elected as a 
school Library Assistant and also the leader of Catholic 
Students, so I felt very joyous.

It was in March 1985 when one of my fellow students borrowed my 
wristwatch and after sometime he broke a glass of that watch I 
got angry when he was telling me but the anger didn't take long 
to fade.

When I was about to write my Junior Certificate Exams, I received 
sad news telling me that my elder sister had passed away.

The joy came to me when I heard that I was going to start a 
Medical course at the Lilongwe School for Health Sciences.

The emotion came when a certain boy opened my locker without my 
knowledge.

The sadness came to me when I heard that my girlfriend whom I 
loved so much got married to another man before a rebuff from 
her.

When I was told that I was selected to attend Medical Assistant 
Training.

This situation happened when my friend John ate my banana which I 
kept in the cupboard.
When I was told that my father had passed away.

When my father married a certain lady. The reception was held at 
Kasungu town Hall.

I felt angry when I was told that I had not been selected to go 
to the University.

I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because I 
was within the row of students who were making noise.

My girlfriend who had been very far away from me came to my 
place. She saw me and ran after me. I didn't know that she had 
come. I couldn't see her. She held my shoulders standing behind 
me.

My girlfriend mentioned a certain girl's name who was my girl 
some time back and she is no longer mine that she said she was 
still mine.

I had been caught red-handed having stolen some paw-paw. I was 
then taken the elders owning the paw-paws.

This happened when I was selected to go to Secondary school to 
start Form I in October 1980.

My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her 
chatting with another guy.

I really became sad when mother passed away while I was very 
young.

I felt joy when I passed my Malawi School Certificate of 
Education.

I was angry when I heard that my only girl was going about with 
another man. So I decided to drop her but later the story came to 
be untrue.

When I was not selected to go to the University of Malawi I felt 
very sad.
When I married my wife and took her home for the first time.
When I was charmed by my relatives.
When my mother died in August 1978.

My friend took me to Civo Stadium to watch and listen to the 
music of the International singer Sam Mangwana. I had no hope of 
going there since I had no money so he gave me the money for 
admission.

I felt angry when I heard that my sister had failed the 
Examinations which we hoped she was going to pass with 
distinctions.

I felt sad when I heard that my girlfriend was double-crossing me 
with the boy who is my best friend.
The joy came when I first proposed a girl at Secondary School.

I was very angry when I heard that my brother was beaten by his 
friends.

I was very sad when I heard about the death of my teacher who 
taught me in Standard 8.
My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.

I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I 
planned this when I was working in the hospital. When I went to 
the house I found that a friend had taken my bike without my 
consent.

It was in the evening when I heard that my girl went to Zambia 
and that she would never come back.

This emotion happened when I passed my primary school examination 
and was selected for Secondary School.

I was very angry when one day I went to see my girlfriend I 
talked to her and could not answer back. She was depressed for 
reasons which were not known to me.

I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I 
was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in 
the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.

It was August 30th when I heard on the radio that I passed my 
M.C.E. exams and I was really happy and joyous because of the 
event.

I once was accused of falling in love with someone's girlfriend 
which was not true because the girl was just a friend of mine.

It was when I failed standard 8 exams while all my friends 
passed and went to secondary school. In class I was always 
getting more marks than they did.

It was when I was allowed to take my wife away from her parents 
after being refused for three times on grounds that she should 
first write her examination.

It was when my Instructor awoke me late at night to get prepared 
for the training at Military college when he was coming back from 
his personal social activities.

I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and 
my best possessions got burnt in there.

This came in when at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to 
fall in love with me. Fortunately I tried my luck and she accepted 
my proposal. At the same time she was giving me a lot of money 
which was just like a miracle to me.

I experienced this when one of my friends reported to the 
Headmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the information 
was not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before the 
Headmaster.
When I was at school.

That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly 
9,000 people attended in all the three regions of Malawi. My joy 
came after hearing on the radio that I was one of the people 
selected to undergo the Medical Assistant training at the 
L.S.H.S.

I was once this week angry when soemone trying to compress my 
mind due to his nonsense speech which himself could not tolerate 
at all.

This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was 
brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.

It was when I was selected to go to a Secondary school to start 
form I.

It was when my friend had stolen my money (K10) and had 
disappeared.

It was when my father was taken into detention by the CIDS for 
two years for a reason I don't know up to now.

Time had struck 8 o'clock when I heard from the radio that I had 
been selected to Robert Blake Secondary School for Form I. I was 
very happy for the selection. My parents and I were very happy 
and full of joy.
I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.

I was away to school (Primary). In my abscence my young brother 
at home got sick suddenly. My parents took him to hospital. On 
the way he died. It came to me as a sad, sudden and shocking 
news and I felt very sad.

When I heard that I had passed Primary School Leaving Certificate 
and was selected to go for Secondary education.

When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of 
medical uniform.
When I heard that my father had passed away.

I met my girlfriend on the way and she joyfully welcomed me on 
the way home.

An incident occurred to me when I was going home with my 
girlfriend. On the way, a man named Banda grabbed my girlfriend 
in my presence. I was really angry with him and as a result I 
threw stones at him and he ran away.

When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and 
up to this moment my sadness is still on.

I felt happy when I saw my brother at the bus depot after 3 
months without seing each other.

When they put the blame on me when I scored the third goal at the 
match.

I felt very sad when I lost my three Kwacha at civo Stadium when 
Sam Mangwana was playing some Rumba records. That was not what I 
expected, I wanted some Disco records.

On December the 28th I was filled with Joy when I was told by my 
bosses that I had been selected to attend a course at the 
Lilongwe School for Health Scienced in Lilongwe.

It was at Malawi Army, Dormer Squadron, when some of my workmates 
got promoted to Seargents (sgts) we were having similar 
Ranks.

It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmate 
had an answer sheet, so he tried to peep. The Nursing Tutor 
caught him. During this time I was turning my question paper and 
it made noise. This friend blamed me of causing the whole matter 
for him to be caught.

I felt joy when I heard over the radio that I had been successful 
in my Primary School Leaving Certificate Examination and was 
selected for Secondary School.

When I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed of 
my clothes, wristwatch and my pair of shoes. After investigations 
it was found that all the things were stolen by one of the boys 
in our hostel.

It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from home 
telling me that my father passed away on the previous day with a 
history of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing my 
third year of my Secondary School.
When I had an anticipatory honey-moon with my fiancTe.

When a classmate hit me on my occipital region when I was busy 
studying and concentrating on my classnotes.
When my father died.

When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been 
successful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistant 
training course. I was really happy and I enjoyed myself by 
dancing to music from the Radio cassette.

One day I was really angry when all my food was eaten by a dog. 
My anger was against my mother because she was careless. She 
didn't keep the food in a hidden and proper place.

One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding my 
friendship as lovers with my girlfriend and I was very sad 
because I didn't expect that girl to disappoint me I regarded her 
as being very faithful.

When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School 
out of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful. 
Family History showed that I had done better than all my brothers 
who had passed after repeating for several times.

I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He 
was trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper. 
Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was 
retreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his plate 
with my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me for 
pouring his soup.

I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football 
match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was 
disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.

I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when I 
heard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip to 
attend a wedding ceremony.
Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.

My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconscious 
and gained consciousness after some time. That time I was at 
school this news reached me through someone.

I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to 
her and at the same time she accepted my proposal.

There was a cup final match between Limbe Leaf Wanderers and 
Silver Strikers and someone promised to give me some money for 
admission fee to watch this game. Unfortunately he did not give 
me.

I had received bad news informing me that grandmother and 
grandfather had passed away. The first one to die was my 
grandmother and after two days grandfather died too.
Passing a very difficult examination which I didn't expect - MCE.
Brother took my money to use for his own purposes.

After hearing the news about the death of my sister, I felt very 
sad.
When I was selected to a University College of Nursing.

When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write 
Examinations in a few minutes.
When I failed my Standard 8 Examination for the first time.

I felt joy when I heard my name being called on the radio as one 
of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was 
selected to start Nursing.

I felt angry at one time when I was chatting with friends and 
suddenly another friend joined us and started opposing any 
comment I added to our chatting.

I felt sad when a thief stole all the clothes from my friend's 
cupboard at school (boarding).
When I passed my MSCE Exams and was selected to go to college.

My best friend started moving out with my boyfriend. When I heard 
this my heart sank because I didn't expect that my own good 
friend could do such a thing, so I got angry.

I was sad when I heard that my cousin died because of being 
bewitched by her husband's second wife.
When I was selected to come here.

This was when my boyfriend told me that I was double-crossing him 
with a certain boy.
When I heard that my friend had started drinking beer.

When the church choir came one Sunday after being away for some 
weeks.
When a little brother of mine damaged a cassette.

I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes 
came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents 
attention by talking to them.
When I had my first boyfriend.

During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary School 
had planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. Soche 
Hotel after missing each other for such a long time. When I asked 
my mother for permission, she told me not to go for no good 
reason. I felt very angry with her.

When I was transferred from Chichiri Secondary School to St. 
Mary's Sec. School. I was happy at Chichiri as a day scholer and 
had made a lot of friends. I was going to a boarding and that 
meant parting with my friends as well as my boyfriend for the 
first time.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for a 
University course.

One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and 
took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and 
used it for her business without my knowledge.

It was shocking news to me when I received a telegram from home 
telling me that my grandmother had passed away. I had to go home to attend 
the funeral but unfortunately I found that the burial had already 
taken place.

I wrote a difficult Exam at one time while in my Secodary School. 
When the results were announced on the radio, I came second out 
of 80 students hence I felt joy.

Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and 
difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.
I experienced this emotion when my grandfather passed away.
When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.
When I damaged my wristwatch which I liked very much.
When my cousin passed away.

I had stayed for months without seeing mother because our 
holidays were short and my home is far. Some times, mother came to 
see me at school, I was very joyful, and I didn't want her to go.

It was during the beginning of the term. I had K100 and kept it 
in my handbag. I left the handbag in the wardrobe but didn't 
lock it. Next time I found that K30 were stolen.

My best friend had failed Exams. She had to leave and so we got 
separated.

I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to be 
announced on radio. After a long period of waiting the results 
were released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by joy.

I went to a fair where a guy who was drunk kept bothering me and 
in the end I got really angry.

When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic 
accident.

I was given a gift by my sister. There were many pleasant things 
in this parcel.

I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as I 
thought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done so 
well.
I lost my purse that had money in it. I was sad until I found it.

The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving 
Exams and I was selected to go to college.

I was angry when someone stole a magazine which I had borrowed 
from another friend and locked it in a drawer.

When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to 
prepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn at 
last that she would not turn up.
When I had passed MCE examinations.

I was angry when my friends said that I should not receive 
Nursing Science books because there was a rumour that I was 
intending to leave the college.
When my cousin passed away.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected to 
come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.
I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.
I felt sad when my father was sick.

The time I learnt that I had passed my Malawi School leaving 
Certificate Examinations.
A tailor ran away with my skirt.
Cooks refused to give me food.
A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.

Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend 
came to shout at me at twelve midnight. It was because she 
thought I was still interested in the boy.

In May 18th, 1984 my boyfriend went to the U.S.A. In December I 
was told he passed away. He had cancer of the Oesophagus.
When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.

I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that I 
was the quietest girl in class.

It was extremely sad to me when I heard that a patient who I was 
taking care of in hospital had passed away. He had some abdominal 
pains.
The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had passed my Secondary 
school leaving certificate exam.
I was angry when my boyfriend did not turn up as promised.

I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed away 
untimely at home.

When my boyfriend came form Rumphi to Lilongwe for a visit I was 
very happy to see him and couldn't believe it was him with me.

I had been in love with a certain young man who pretended to love 
me but one day I found out that he had another girlfriend who was 
also a friend of mine.

I wrote a letter to my boyfriend but he couldn't answer it in 
time so as a defence mechanism I just found that I felt so sad 
about it and couldn't talk to anyone.

When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I 
was ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they were 
very hard.

The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging the 
classroom door when I didn't in front of the whole class.

I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a car 
accident and was admitted in hospital.
When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.
When my dress was stolen.
When my grandmother died after a long illness.

I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8 
exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my 
birthday.

I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many 
bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the 
girls who did him wrong.
I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.

When I heard that I had passed my MCE Exam, I spent the whole 
day dancing and eating sugarcanes from our garden.

When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I 
wrote him an insulting letter to him and called him names.

When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for 
a week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go to 
bath.

It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced on 
the radio. When I heard my name that I had done well I just kept 
quiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.

A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married 
here, when I am here at school. When I went home for holidays my 
parents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.

When I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew had 
passed away I was very sad for the children were not even sick 
before death but suddenly died.

I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil) 
from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became 
No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.

I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweep 
some orange peels. It was my friends who were supposed to sweep, 
but the teacher told me to do it.

I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed the 
standard 8 exams for the third time.

I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running 
competition.

I was angry when I had not been granted a leave out pass during 
the last weekend.
I was sad to hear that my brother had a motorbike accident.
When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.

Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended and 
later was telling me that he couldn't give it back to me because I was 
rude at a certain time.
My boyfriend didn't turn up after promising that he was coming.

After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and being 
selected to Kamuzu College of Nursing.

The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed away 
after he showed had his meals.
When my grandmother passed away.

The time when my sister had her first baby I was so happy and 
joyous because she stayed for two days after marriage before she 
had a child.
I was so angry with a patient who refused to take drugs.

When I heard of the death of a friend who had just finished her 
training I felt very sad for she was young.

I felt joyful when I heard that I had been selected for College 
education.
I felt angry when my friend told me that I had stolen her money.

I felt sad when I heard that my cousin had passed away just 
suddenly.

I received money from my father at a time when I was completely 
broken.

One of my friends went and told another friend of mine that I was 
going abut with another guy in Lilongwe besides the one I had. 
She said I was seen with him hand in hand.
I received a letter form home telling me that my sister was very sick.

I was selected to come here (University, College) when I was least 
expecting it.

It was when I discovered that my boyfriend had another girl. I 
discovered it through a letter he wrote to the girl when he was 
away. When I asked him he accepted it.

My child passed away after a short illness when he was just 
eleven months old. I was only told about his death without 
knowing that he had been ill.
Accepted by the college football team.
Made mistakes in exam.
Failing examn.
Article published in the college newspaper.
My friend misunderstood me.
My grandmother died.

Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through 
police.
Listening to long speech of the party leaders wasting my time.
My girl-friend left me.
Helping in the nursery school.
My bed sheet (present of my parents) damaged by roommate.
Not being accepted by classmates in university.
Got a present from my friend for my birthday.

South Korea winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympic (more 
than China).
Saw the village I come from still pay money to buy wife.

Coming to this lecture and listen to you talking about feelings, 
I am so happy that foreigners have the same feelings as Chinese.

Too many people in TV room, I was not able to get a seat to watch 
TV.
My sister marrying a bad man. He is cruel to her.
Discussing psychology with my friends before the lecture.

I could not find my monthly tickets for the bus when I was on the 
bus.

Two little children (5/6 years old) begging for money, and noone 
gave them money.
You told me psychology can help people to be happier.
Bus conductor insulted me for not buying a ticket (I forgot).
Saw a father beating up his small child.
My parents came to visit me.
Saw in the TV South Korea cheating in the Asian Olympic games.
General Ye Jianying died.
My friend told me he really likes me.
South Korea cheating for gold medals.
My friend has to go on field trips, he just told me.
I met a friend I had not seen for a long time on the street.
Overhear people talking about me and saying that I am stupid.

Hearing about developments of sience in the West a lot better 
than China.
Scoared a goal in a football match.
Someone called me a disgusting nickname.
Not getting on with someone of my classmates in high school.
My class winning against another class in a football match.
A friend forgot his appointment with me.
A friend misunderstood me.
Meeting an old friend from high school.
Misunderstood deliberately by a close friend.
My old teacher in primary school died.
My old friend visited me in the university.
My roommate was rude to me.
My uncle died in the Vietnam War.
Scoring a goal in football match.
I was told to do something I did not want to do.
Finding out that China is still backward in science.

Saw in TV that China had the most gold medals in the Asian 
Olympic.
Insulted by teacher.
Finding out I am not good looking.

Joining in a research group studying consumer's behaviour and 
helping the people in the shop with the sales.
A classmate damaged ma iron and tried to hide the damage.
Not winning a medal in the swimming contest.
China winning the Asian Olympic.
Korean judges cheating.
My father left us for another woman.
Being together with my best friend.
Heard about someone telling lies about me to my best friend.
My best friend suddenly acting strange towards me.
My best friend chosen for your English lectures.

My class leader told me the university won't let all of us go to 
your lectures because we are not All English Class.
When I was not chosen to go to your English lectures.
Finding out my best friend cannot go to the English lectures.
Receiving a letter from a boy I care.

My parents do not like my friend and told me not to go out with 
him.
My grandmother died.
Finding out that I can go to your English lectures.
Being sexually assulted on a bus.
Finding out that my best friend could not go to university.
Getting into this university.
Being insulted in public.
A girl I love does not love me.
Getting into this university to do medicine.
Misunderstood by a close friend for the wrong reason.

Finding out that China is poor, so we cannot have good reference 
books.
Aticle published.
Made a statement that other people did not believe.
